Bash(python3 -c "
import pandas as pd

# Read the Excel file
df = pd.read_excel\(''data/Whova_agenda_import_2025.xlsx''\)

# Save as CSV
df.to_csv\(''data/Whova_agenda_import_2025.csv'', index=False\)

print\(''Successfully converted Excel to CSV!''\)
print\(f''Total rows: {len\(df\)}''\)
print\(f''Total columns: {len\(df.columns\)}''\)
print\(''\\nColumn names:''\)
for col in df.columns:
    print\(f''  - {col}''\)
print\(''\\nFirst row sample:''\)
print\(df.iloc[0]\)
")

Bash(python3 -c "
import pandas as pd

# Read the CSV we created and examine it
df_raw = pd.read_csv\(''data/Whova_agenda_import_2025.csv''\)

# The actual headers are at row index 31 \(line 32\)
# Let''s read from row 32 \(index 31\) onwards
df_raw_from_start = pd.read_csv\(''data/Whova_agenda_import_2025.csv'', skiprows=31\)

# The first row should have proper column names now
print\(''Columns detected:''\)
for col in df_raw_from_start.columns:
    print\(f''  - {col}''\)

# Remove empty rows
df_clean = df_raw_from_start.dropna\(how=''all''\)

# Save cleaned version
df_clean.to_csv\(''data/whova_agenda.csv'', index=False\)

print\(f''\\nTotal events saved: {len\(df_clean\)}''\)
print\(''\\nFirst few events:''\)
print\(df_clean.head\(3\).to_string\(\)\)
")
